metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0410 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockitcomponent in Oracle Java SE 5.0u75, 6u85, 7u72, and 8u25; Java SE Embedded7u71 and 8u6; and JRockit R27.8.4 and R28.3.4 allows remote attackers toaffect availability via unknown vectors related to Security.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0410` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
openjdk-7-source - 7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1
No subscription required

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-demo - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-source - 6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u75-2.5.4-1~trusty1').
openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b34-1.13.6-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
